body.p:
To His Excellency Thos E Bramlette
Governor of the State of Kentucky

Your Petitioners would Respectfully represent to your Excellency that at the ^November^ November Term of the Carter Circuit Court 1863 Joseph Courtnay was fined by Said Court for a Breach of the peace Twenty Dollars Now your petition are well acquainted with Said Courtney. he is a poor man with a family of Small Children and is dependant in his daily labor for a support The facts of the Case are these a Man by the name of Ratcliff was prosecuting a Writ of Forcible Detainer against him to turn him out of doors Ratcliffs Loyalty was doubted and Courtney, not feeling pleasant under the Circumstances gave him a Cursing there being no licks whatever Struck and we think the fees and Costs will be sufficient punishment, to him wherefore we ask that said fine. be Remitted

J. H. Steele. M. D
H. B. Eifort
Vincent Ferguson
T S McClees J P C C
L Dodge_
Thomas Smith
B. S. Shepherd
Carter County
Relief Refused
Tho E Bramlette
